lines.text: Subj: Second Quarter '97 US Competitive Update
Enclosed is the latest update. It's distribution is limited to people who have asked for it
because we are still evolving the concept of quarterly updates to best fit B&W's needs.
What it represents so far is a quarterly summary of competitive news, with volume/share/profit
highlights. We are trying to limit its size, since much of it is a re-hash for people who have
followed daily newsclips and analyst reports.
On the other hand, we think it is worth doing quarterly as a recap -
for those who may have missed some newsclips or analyst reports,
for lower level staff who are interested in competitive info but do not have regular access to
and to try to tie together some daily events and speculate on possible underlying
We would appreciate your advice. Is this helpful to you and some of your staff, or is it extra
paper that doesn't add much value?
What could we do for next quarter that would be more helpful?

MEMORANDUM
LOUISVILLE
To
Jeff Eckmann
Kim Matthews
Rolf Provan
Mike Walter
cC:
Carl Schoenbachler
Subj: Second Quarter '97 US Competitive Update
August 20, 1997
Enclosed is the latest update. It's distribution is limited to people who have asked for it
because we are still evolving the concept of quarterly updates to best fit B&W's needs.
What it represents so far is a quarterly summary of competitive news, with volume/share/profit
highlights. We are trying to limit its size, since much of it is a re-hash for people who have
followed daily newsclips and analyst reports.
On the other hand, we think it is worth doing quarterly as a recap -
for those who may have missed some newsclips or analyst reports,
for lower level staff who are interested in competitive info but do not have regular access to
newsclips and reports,
and to try to tie together some daily events and speculate on possible underlying
competitive strategies and motivations.
We would appreciate your advice. Is this helpful to you and some of your staff, or is it extra
paper that doesn't add much value?
What could we do for next quarter that would be more helpful?
Thank you,
Doug 7245
303972
